cyclone.name: LAURA
cyclone.current_location: about 60 mi southwest of Ponce, Puerto Rico
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-northwest across Hispaniola and Cuba, then forecast to enter the Gulf of Mexico and curve northwest toward the north-central Gulf Coast (Louisiana-Texas border area)
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Louisiana coast near Plaquemines Parish/upper Barataria Bay area

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watches presently limited to portions of the Bahamas and eastern Cuba – no watches yet along the Gulf Coast
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical-storm warnings in effect for Puerto Rico, U.S. Virgin Islands, northern & southern Dominican Republic coast, northern Haiti, SE Bahamas & Turks and Caicos – none yet for Gulf Coast
weather_observation.impacted_coast: north-central Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana through upper Texas expected to see direct impacts late Wednesday into Thursday
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (39–57 mph) possible at the port late Wednesday night into early Thursday, with a 33 % overall chance of 34-kt winds and 10 % chance of 50-kt winds.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Elevated risk of storm surge greater than 3 ft along Plaquemines Parish if the center tracks just west of the river delta; exact height depends on future intensity but early guidance suggests several feet of inundation are possible.
weather_observation.rainfall: Potential for 4–8 inches of rain with locally higher totals as the system comes ashore, producing flash-flood risk in low-lying areas of the port complex.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes could occur in outer rain bands Wednesday night and Thursday; rough surf and dangerous marine conditions will affect approaches to the Mississippi River days in advance.
